clinical_study.brief_title: Maternal HIV: Trial to Assist Disclosure to Children
clinical_study.official_title: 2/2-Maternal HIV: Multisite Trial to Assist Disclosure to Children

primary_outcome.measure: Disclosure of Maternal HIV status to child
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in disclosure status between time points 3-, 9-, & 15 month follow ups

secondary_outcome.description: Self and Caregiver reported indicators, including the Child Depression Inventory, Piers-Harris Children's Self-Concept Scale, Penn State Worry Questionnaire

other_outcome.description: CES-D, GAD-7, Health-Related Anxiety Questionnaire, Medical Outcomes Study-Health Self-Report, Alcohol and Drug Assessment
Cohesiveness, routines, parent-child communication, parent-child relationship quality

arm_group.description: Participants in the wait-list control condition will receive a group-based version of the TRACK intervention after their 15-month follow up appointment.
3-session, individually administered psycho-educational intervention to promote maternal disclosure of HIV status to child

intervention.description: TRACK Intervention 3-session, individually administered psycho-educational intervention to promote maternal disclosure of HIV status to child

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mother is HIV+
- ability of mother and child to speak and understand English or Spanish
- child is not HIV+
- Child is 6-14 years old
- Child is unaware of maternal HIV status
- child resides with mother
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mother does not consent
- Child does not assent
- Psychosis of mother or child
- Child diagnosed with depression
- child is developmentally delayed
- Recent or anticipated death in the family

patient_data.ipd_description: Data sharing protocols for the longitudinal data from 220 young children and 220 mothers will be in accordance with NIH Notice of Amendment to A-110, consistent with IRB-approved consent restrictions, and follow Inter-University Consortium for Political and Social Research guidelines for data preparation. Data will be stripped of identifiers and available under signed agreement for: (1) using data only for research; (2) securing date using appropriate technology; and (3) destroying or returning data after analyses. Notice of available data will be on both centers' websites, with data use restrictions.
